New Records: Lesotho will make their debut in the Africa Cup of Nations qualifiers after a historical achievement.
Motebang Sera scored his 12th international goal, leaving him three goals behind Lesotho's all-time top scorer Jane Thabantso.
Pre-Game Insights: Morocco are the overwhelming favorites in this clash, and this is further boosted as the game will be played on their soil despite Lesotho being the hosts.
Lesotho's draw in a World Cup qualifier suggests they can compete despite challenges.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Lesotho's first-ever meeting against Morocco is a historical moment for them.
Morocco are unbeaten in their last five matches across all competitions, winning the last three and scoring 10 goals in the last two.
Others: Lesotho's attacking quartet includes Motebang Sera, Lehlohonolo Fothoane, and Tsepang Sefali.
Morocco's Walid Regragui could make changes to give everyone in the squad minutes.
